context: There was a raven from Kings Landing. Jon Arryn is dead. A fever took him. I know he was like a father to you.
context/1: I am so sorry, my love.
context/2: It's your gods with all the rules.
context/3: I wonder if the old gods agree.
context/4: You have five northern children. You're not an outsider.
context/5: All these years and I still feel like an outsider when I come here.
context/6: That's an honor I can do without. Their days are too long, their lives are too short.
context/7: You should be the Hand of the king.

context: Where will they go? Their mother's dead.
context/2: There are no direwolves south of the Wall.
context/6: There are no mountain lions in these woods.

response: What if Jon Arryn told someone?
context: There was nothing to be afraid of until you told father. [In a whisper, mimicking] We're Lannisters. Lannisters don't act like fools.
context/0: And you never worry about anything. When we were seven, you jumped off the cliffs as Casterly Rock. One hundred foot drop into the water. And you were never afraid.
context/1: As your brother, I feel it's my duty to warn you
context/2: The runt of the litter. That one's yours, Snow.
context/4: I'm not a Stark. Get on.
context/6: You will train them yourselves. You will feed them yourselves. And if they die, you will bury them yourselves.
context/7: Lord Stark? There are five pups. One for each of the Stark children. The direwolf is the sigil of your House. They were meant to have them.

response: There are no mountain lions in these woods.
context/1: A madman sees what he sees.
context/3: The White Walkers have been gone for thousands of years.
context/4: Is it true he saw the White Walkers?
context/5: The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword.
context/6: Our way is the old way?
context/7: But do you understand why I had to kill him?

response: Is it true he saw the White Walkers?
context: The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword.
context/0: Our way is the old way?
context/1: But do you understand why I had to kill him?
context/2: Jon said he was a deserter.
context/3: You understand why I did it?
context/5: Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and protector of the realm, I, Eddard of the House Stark, Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North, sentence you to die.
context/6: Father will know if you do.
context/7: King of the Andals and the First Men …

response: He won't be a boy forever. And winter is coming.
context: Ned. Ten is too young to see such things.
context/1: The law is law, my lady.
context/4: Get the lads to saddle their horses.
context/5: Lord Stark. My lady. A guardsman just rode in from the hills. They've captured a deserter from the Night's Watch.

response: I am so sorry, my love.
context: It's your gods with all the rules.
context/0: I wonder if the old gods agree.
context/1: You have five northern children. You're not an outsider.
context/2: All these years and I still feel like an outsider when I come here.
context/3: That's an honor I can do without. Their days are too long, their lives are too short.
context/4: You should be the Hand of the king.
context/5: If he told the king, both our heads would be skewered on the city gates by now. Whatever Jon Arryn knew or didn't know, it died with him. And Robert will choose a new Hand of the king, someone to do his job while he's off fucking boars and hunting whores. Or is it the other way around? And life will go on.

response: I love the detail that you've managed to get in this corners. … Quite beautiful … the stitching …
context/0: Fine work, as always. Well done.
context/7: Your dead men seem to have moved camp.

response: It's a good thing we're not children. You want to run away south, run away. Of course, they will behead you as a deserter … If I don't catch you first. Get back on your horse. I won't say it again.
context: Whatever did it to them could do it to us. They even killed the children.
context/0: You don't think he'll ask us how they died? Get back on your horse.
context/1: Our orders were to track the wildlings. We tracked them. They won't trouble us no more.
context/3: We should head back to the wall.
context/6: I've never seen wildlings do a thing like this. I've never seen a thing like this, not ever in my life.
context/7: What do you expect? They're savages. One lot steals a goat from another lot and before you know it, they're ripping each other to pieces.
